metadata.Title: CVE-2023-6176 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - high.
metadata.Description:
A null pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernel API for the cryptographic algorithm scatterwalk functionality. This issue occurs when a user constructs a malicious packet with specific socket configuration, which could allow a local user to crash the system or escalate their privileges on the system.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6176` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-167-generic - 5.4.0-169.187
linux-image-5.4.0-167-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-169.187
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-167-generic - 5.4.0-169.187
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-167-lowlatency - 5.4.0-169.187
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1114-aws - 5.4.0-1115.125
No subscription required
